switches.description: Generate verify oop checks in AOT code
switches.name: AOTVerifyOops

switches.description:
Enables instruction profiling on assembler level. Valid values are a
comma separated list of supported instructions. Compare with subclasses
of Assembler.InstructionCounter.
switches.name: ASMInstructionProfiling

switches.description:
Abort VM with SIGILL if benchmark counters controlled by the
(Generic|Timed|Benchmark)DynamicCounters
option overflow. This feature is only supported on AMD64.
WARNING: No descriptive error message will be printed! In case of an overflow,
manual inspection of the emitted code is required.
switches.name: AbortOnBenchmarkCounterOverflow

switches.description:
Overwrites the available number of processors provided by the OS. Any
value <= 0 means using the processor count from the OS.
switches.name: ActiveProcessorCount

switches.description:
File to which aggregated metrics are dumped at shutdown. A CSV format
is used if the file ends with .csv otherwise a more human readable
format is used. If not specified, metrics are dumped to the console.
switches.name: AggregatedMetricsFile

switches.description:
Model all array type flows using a unique elements type flow
abstraction.
switches.name: AliasArrayTypeFlows

switches.description:
The minimum size in bytes required for printing an allocation profiling
entry
switches.name: AllocationProfilingThreshold

switches.description:
A context sensitive heap means that each heap allocated object is
modeled by using at least the allocation site.
switches.name: AllocationSiteSensitiveHeap

switches.description: Unconditionally inline intrinsics
switches.name: AlwaysInlineIntrinsics

switches.description: Force all freshly committed pages to be pre-touched
switches.name: AlwaysPreTouch

switches.description:
Controls the static analysis context sensitivity. Available values:
insens (context insensitive analysis), allocsens (context insensitive
analysis, context insensitive heap, allocation site sensitive heap),
_1obj (1 object sensitive analysis with a context insensitive heap),
_2obj1h (2 object sensitive with a 1 context sensitive heap)
switches.name: AnalysisContextSensitivity

switches.description:
The maximum size of type and method profiles returned by the static
analysis. -1 indicates no limitation.
switches.name: AnalysisSizeCutoff

switches.description: Analysis results statistics file.
switches.name: AnalysisStatisticsFile

switches.description: Record stack trace along with scoped foreign object reference wrappers to debug issue with a wrapper being used after its scope has closed.
switches.name: AuditHandles

switches.description:
The base target spending used to estimate the inlining threshold; the
higher, the likelier it is to inline.
switches.name: BaseTargetSpending

switches.description: Use a cutoff to print only most significant counters.
switches.name: BenchmarkCounterPrintingCutoff

switches.description: Dump dynamic counters
switches.name: BenchmarkCountersDumpDynamic

switches.description: Dump static counters
switches.name: BenchmarkCountersDumpStatic

switches.description:
File to which benchmark counters are dumped. A CSV format is used if
the file ends with .csv otherwise a more human readable format is used.
The fields in the CSV format are: category, group, name, value
switches.name: BenchmarkCountersFile

switches.description:
Turn on the benchmark counters. The format of this option is:
          
  (err|out),start pattern,end pattern
  
Start counting when the start pattern matches on the given stream and stop when the end pattern occurs.
You can use "~" to match 1 or more digits.
Examples:
          
  err, starting =====, PASSED in
  out,Iteration ~ (~s) begins:,Iteration ~ (~s) ends:
  
The first pattern matches DaCapo output and the second matches SPECjvm2008 output.
          
As a more detailed example, here are the options to use for getting statistics
about allocations within the DaCapo pmd benchmark:
          
  -XX:JVMCICounterSize=<value> -XX:-JVMCICountersExcludeCompiler \
  -Dgraal.BenchmarkDynamicCounters="err, starting ====, PASSED in " \
  -Dgraal.ProfileAllocations=true
  
The JVMCICounterSize value depends on the granularity of the profiling -
10000 should be sufficient. Omit JVMCICountersExcludeCompiler to exclude
counting allocations on the compiler threads.
The counters can be further configured by the ProfileAllocationsContext option.
          
We highly recommend the use of -Dgraal.AbortOnBenchmarkCounterOverflow=true to
detect counter overflows eagerly.
switches.name: BenchmarkDynamicCounters

switches.description: Do not compile anything on bootstrap but just initialize the compiler.
switches.name: BootstrapInitializeOnly

switches.description:
Maximum time in minutes to spend bootstrapping (0 to disable this
limit).
switches.name: BootstrapTimeout

switches.description:
Ratio of the maximum compilation rate below which the bootstrap
compilation rate must not fall (0 or less disables monitoring).
switches.name: BootstrapWatchDogCriticalRateRatio

switches.description: Break chained phis
switches.name: BreakChainedPhis

switches.description:
Controls the maximum number of compiler nodes that can appear in the
call graph
switches.name: CallGraphCompilerNodeLimit

switches.description: Controls the maximum size of the call graph before ceasing inlining.
switches.name: CallGraphSizeLimit

switches.description: Reduces the likelihood of exploring call graph subtrees that are large.
switches.name: CallGraphSizePenaltyCoefficient

switches.description: Exclude virtual nodes when dumping canonical text for graphs.
switches.name: CanonicalGraphStringsCheckConstants

switches.description: Exclude virtual nodes when dumping canonical text for graphs.
switches.name: CanonicalGraphStringsExcludeVirtuals

switches.description:
Attempts to remove object identity hashes when dumping canonical text
for graphs.
switches.name: CanonicalGraphStringsRemoveIdentities

switches.description: Clear the debug metrics after bootstrap.
switches.name: ClearMetricsAfterBootstrap

switches.description:
Determines if a full GC collects the young generation separately or
together with the old generation.
switches.name: CollectYoungGenerationSeparately

switches.description: Treat compilation bailouts like compilation failures.
switches.name: CompilationBailoutAsFailure

switches.description:
The number of compilations allowed for any method before the VM exits
(a value of 0 means there is no limit).
switches.name: CompilationCountLimit

switches.description:
Exclude certain phases from compilation, either unconditionally or with
a method filter
switches.name: CompilationExcludePhases

switches.description:
Time limit in seconds before a compilation expires (0 to disable the
limit). A non-zero value for this option is doubled if assertions are
enabled and quadrupled if DetailedAsserts is true.
switches.name: CompilationExpirationPeriod

switches.description:
Specifies the action to take when compilation fails.
          
The accepted values are:
    Silent  - Print nothing to the console.
     Print  - Print a stack trace to the console.
  Diagnose* - Retry the compilation with extra diagnostics.
    ExitVM  - Same as Diagnose except that the VM process exits after retrying.
    
* If "Diagnose" is set compilation will be retried with extra diagnostics enabled including dumping (see file:doc-files/DumpHelp.txt). 
  In such a scenario DiagnoseDumpLevel can be used to specify the dump level (DebugContext dump levels) accordingly.
switches.name: CompilationFailureAction

switches.description:
Size of the reserved address space of each compilation isolate (0:
default for new isolates).
switches.name: CompilationIsolateAddressSpaceSize

switches.description:
Interval in seconds between a watch dog reporting stack traces for long
running compilations.
switches.name: CompilationWatchDogStackTraceInterval

switches.description:
Delay in seconds before watch dog monitoring a compilation (0 disables
monitoring).
switches.name: CompilationWatchDogStartDelay

switches.description: In tiered mode compile Graal and JVMCI using optimized first tier code.
switches.name: CompileGraalWithC1Only

switches.description:
Activate runtime compilation in separate isolates (enable support
during image build with option SupportCompileInIsolates).
switches.name: CompileInIsolates

switches.description:
Create one reusable isolate per compilation thread as opposed to one
isolate per compilation (enable through CompileInIsolates).
switches.name: CompileInPerThreadReusedIsolates

switches.description:
Names the compiler configuration to use. If omitted, the compiler
configuration with the highest auto-selection priority is used. To see
the set of available configurations, supply the value 'help' to this
option.
switches.name: CompilerConfiguration

switches.description:
Controls the likelihood of exploring subtrees that already have a lot
of code during inlining.
switches.name: CompilerNodePenaltyCoefficient

switches.description: Selects the system compiler. This must match the getCompilerName() value returned by a jdk.vm.ci.runtime.JVMCICompilerFactory provider. An empty string or the value "null" selects a compiler that will raise an exception upon receiving a compilation request.
switches.name: Compiler

switches.description: Number of threads concurrent gc will use
switches.name: ConcGCThreads

switches.description:
Consider the vectorizability of loop during the duplication of a merge
inside a loop.There are rare cases where duplication can destroy
vectorization.
switches.name: ConsiderVectorizableLoops

switches.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Abstract cost for the creation of a new
live value: new values can have a negativeimpact on register
allocation, therefore we penalize it.
switches.name: CostNewLiveVariable

switches.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Cost/Benefit heuristic for EE floating node
duplication: reduce cost by a constant factor when comparing with
relative benefit.
switches.name: CostReductionFactor

switches.description:
Pattern for specifying scopes in which counters are enabled. See the
Dump option for the pattern syntax. An empty value enables all counters
unconditionally.
switches.name: Count

switches.description:
Comma separated names of counters that are enabled irrespective of the
value for Count option. An empty value enables all counters
unconditionally.
switches.name: Counters

switches.description:
Converts an exception triggered by the CrashAt option into a fatal
error if a non-null pointer was passed in the _fatal option to
JNI_CreateJavaVM. This option exists for the purpose of testing fatal
error handling in libgraal.
switches.name: CrashAtIsFatal

switches.description:
Pattern for method(s) that will trigger an exception when compiled.
This option exists to test handling compilation crashes gracefully. See
the MethodFilter option for the pattern syntax. A ':Bailout' suffix
will raise a bailout exception and a ':PermanentBailout' suffix will
raise a permanent bailout exception.
switches.name: CrashAt

switches.description:
Controls the likelihood of further exploring subtrees with a lot of
code during inlining.
switches.name: CutoffCodeSizePenaltyCoefficient

switches.description: Debug simulation synonyms during simulation-based loop peeling.
switches.name: DebugPeelingSynonyms

switches.description: Enable debug output for stub code generation and snippet preparation.
switches.name: DebugStubsAndSnippets

switches.description:
Deoptimize OSR compiled code when the OSR entry loop is finished if
there is no mature profile available for the rest of the method.
switches.name: DeoptAfterOSR

switches.description:
Enable expensive assertions if normal assertions (i.e. -ea or -esa) are
enabled.
switches.name: DetailedAsserts

switches.description:
Specify the DumpLevel if CompilationFailureAction#Diagnose is used.See
CompilationFailureAction for details.
file:doc-files/CompilationFailureActionHelp.txt
switches.name: DiagnoseDumpLevel

switches.description: Ignore calls to System.gc()
switches.name: DisableExplicitGC

switches.description: Disable intercepting exceptions in debug scopes.
switches.name: DisableIntercept

switches.description:
Analysis: Detect methods that return one of their parameters and
hardwire the parameter straight to the return.
switches.name: DivertParameterReturningMethod

switches.description: Send compiler IR to dump handlers on error.
switches.name: DumpOnError

switches.description:
Dump a before and after graph if the named phase changes the
graph.%nThe argument is substring matched against the simple name of
the phase class
switches.name: DumpOnPhaseChange

switches.description: The directory where various Graal dump files are written.
switches.name: DumpPath

switches.description:
Filter pattern for specifying scopes in which dumping is enabled.
          
A filter is a list of comma-separated terms of the form:
 
  <pattern>[:<level>]
 
If <pattern> contains a "*" or "?" character, it is interpreted as a glob pattern.
Otherwise, it is interpreted as a substring. If <pattern> is empty, it
matches every scope. If :<level> is omitted, it defaults to 1. The term
~<pattern> is a shorthand for <pattern>:0 to disable a debug facility for a pattern.
          
The default log level is 0 (disabled). Terms with an empty pattern set
the default log level to the specified value. The last
matching term with a non-empty pattern selects the level specified. If
no term matches, the log level is the default level. A filter with no
terms matches every scope with a log level of 1.
          
Examples of debug filters:
--------- 
  (empty string)
          
  Matches any scope with level 1.
--------- 
  :1
          
  Matches any scope with level 1.
--------- 
  *
          
  Matches any scope with level 1.
--------- 
  CodeGen,CodeInstall
          
  Matches scopes containing "CodeGen" or "CodeInstall", both with level 1.
--------- 
  CodeGen:2,CodeInstall:1
          
  Matches scopes containing "CodeGen" with level 2, or "CodeInstall" with level 1.
---------
  Outer:2,Inner:0}
          
  Matches scopes containing "Outer" with log level 2, or "Inner" with log level 0. If the scope
  name contains both patterns then the log level will be 0. This is useful for silencing subscopes.
---------
  :1,Dead:2
          
  Matches scopes containing "Dead" with level 2, and all other scopes with level 1.
--------- 
  Dead:0,:1
          
  Matches all scopes with level 1, except those containing "Dead".   Note that the location of
  the :1 doesn't matter since it's specifying the default log level so it's the same as
  specifying :1,Dead:0.
--------- 
  Code*
          
  Matches scopes starting with "Code" with level 1.
--------- 
  Code,~Dead
          
  Matches scopes containing "Code" but not "Dead", with level 1.
switches.name: Dump

switches.description: Treat any exceptions during dumping as fatal.
switches.name: DumpingErrorsAreFatal

switches.description: Perform Duplications as long as there is any sane improvement.
switches.name: DuplicateALot

switches.description:
When enabled, some limited amount of duplication will be performed in
order compile code containing irreducible loops.
switches.name: DuplicateIrreducibleLoops

switches.description:
Percentage in node cost graph size for the late duplication budget.
Computed relative to the methods code size.
switches.name: DuplicationBudgetFactorLate

switches.description:
Percentage in node cost graph size for the duplication budget. Computed
relative to the methods code size.
switches.name: DuplicationBudgetFactor

switches.description:
Cost/Benefit heuristic for EE simulation-based code duplication: reduce
cost by a constant factor when comparing with relative benefit.
switches.name: DuplicationCostReductionFactor

switches.description: Ignore low frequency branches during duplication.
switches.name: DuplicationMinBranchFrequency

switches.description: Use grouping separators for number printing
switches.name: DynamicCountersPrintGroupSeparator

switches.description: Eagerly construct extra snippet info.
switches.name: EagerSnippets

switches.description: Emit substitutions for String methods
switches.name: EmitStringSubstitutions

switches.description:
Try to eliminate array clone operations by handling clone operations in
early read elimination.
switches.name: EnterpriseCloneReadElimination

switches.description: Run more read eliminations early in the compilation pipeline.
switches.name: EnterpriseEarlyReadElimination

switches.description:
Enable EE version of partial loop unrolling that considers more loop
shapes for unrolling.
switches.name: EnterprisePartialUnroll

switches.description:
Maximum ergonomically set heap size (in bytes); zero means use MaxRAM *
MaxRAMPercentage / 100
switches.name: ErgoHeapSizeLimit

switches.description:
Exclude compilations that MethodFilter.match this string from the
duplication optimization.
switches.name: ExcludeFunctionFromDuplication

switches.description: Scan all objects reachable from roots for analysis. By default false.
switches.name: ExhaustiveHeapScan

switches.description: Alias for CompilationFailureAction=ExitVM.
switches.name: ExitVMOnException

switches.description:
The inertia at which the expand-all proximity bonus decreases with the
number of yet unexpanded nodes.
switches.name: ExpandAllProximityBonusInertia

switches.description:
The decrease in call graph expansion pressure when there are few call
nodes left to explore.
switches.name: ExpandAllProximityBonus

switches.description:
The slowness at which the expansion pressure grows with code size; the
higher it is, the slower the pressure growth.
switches.name: ExpansionInertiaBaseValue

switches.description:
The extra slowness at which the expansion pressure grows with the code
size, for each extra invoke node.
switches.name: ExpansionInertiaInvokeBonus

switches.description:
The max slowness at which the expansion pressure grows with the code
size.
switches.name: ExpansionInertiaMax

switches.description: A System.gc() request invokes a concurrent collection
switches.name: ExplicitGCInvokesConcurrent

switches.description: Enable extended asserts which slow down analysis.
switches.name: ExtendedAsserts

switches.description: Do not bail out but throw an exception on failed loop explosion.
switches.name: FailedLoopExplosionIsFatal

switches.description:
Internal option used to specify runtime java arguments for
FallbackExecutor.
switches.name: FallbackExecutorRuntimeJavaArg

switches.description: Enable Java Flight Recorder.
switches.name: FlightRecorder

switches.description: Force-dump graphs before compilation
switches.name: ForceDumpGraphsBeforeCompilation

switches.description: Force partial unrolling of loops if at all possible.
switches.name: ForceUnroll

switches.description: Perform full unrolling as a Partial Escape Analysis Cleanup
switches.name: FullUnrollAsPEACleanup

switches.description: Target duration of individual concurrent marking steps in milliseconds.
switches.name: G1ConcMarkStepDurationMillis

switches.description: The threshold that defines (>=) a hot card.
switches.name: G1ConcRSHotCardLimit

switches.description: Log base 2 of the length of conc RS hot-card cache.
switches.name: G1ConcRSLogCacheSize

switches.description:
The number of update buffers that are left in the queue by the
concurrent processing threads. Will be selected ergonomically by
default.
switches.name: G1ConcRefinementGreenZone

switches.description:
Maximum number of enqueued update buffers before mutator threads start
processing new ones instead of enqueueing them. Will be selected
ergonomically by default.
switches.name: G1ConcRefinementRedZone

switches.description:
The last concurrent refinement thread wakes up every specified number
of milliseconds to do miscellaneous work.
switches.name: G1ConcRefinementServiceIntervalMillis

switches.description:
The number of parallel rem set update threads. Will be set
ergonomically by default.
switches.name: G1ConcRefinementThreads

switches.description:
Each time the rset update queue increases by this amount activate the
next refinement thread if available. The actual step size will be
selected ergonomically by default, with this value used to determine a
lower bound.
switches.name: G1ConcRefinementThresholdStep

switches.description:
Number of enqueued update buffers that will trigger concurrent
processing. Will be selected ergonomically by default.
switches.name: G1ConcRefinementYellowZone

switches.description: Confidence level for MMU/pause predictions.
switches.name: G1ConfidencePercent

switches.description:
Amount of space, expressed as a percentage of the heap size, that G1 is
willing not to collect to avoid expensive GCs.
switches.name: G1HeapWastePercent

switches.description: The target number of mixed GCs after a marking cycle.
switches.name: G1MixedGCCountTarget

switches.description:
Number of milliseconds after a previous GC to wait before triggering a
periodic gc. A value of zero disables periodically enforced gc cycles.
switches.name: G1PeriodicGCInterval

switches.description:
Determines the kind of periodic GC. Set to true to have G1 perform a
concurrent GC as periodic GC, otherwise use a STW Full GC.
switches.name: G1PeriodicGCInvokesConcurrent

switches.description:
Maximum recent system wide load as returned by the 1m value of
getloadavg() at which G1 triggers a periodic GC. A load above this
value cancels a given periodic GC. A value of zero disables this check.
switches.name: G1PeriodicGCSystemLoadThreshold

switches.description:
Max number of regions for which we keep bitmaps. Will be set
ergonomically by default
switches.name: G1RSetRegionEntries

switches.description:
Max number of entries per region in a sparse table. Will be set
ergonomically by default.
switches.name: G1RSetSparseRegionEntries

switches.description:
A target percentage of time that is allowed to be spend on process RS
update buffers during the collection pause.
switches.name: G1RSetUpdatingPauseTimePercent

switches.description:
The number of discovered reference objects to process before draining
concurrent marking work queues.
switches.name: G1RefProcDrainInterval

switches.description:
It determines the minimum reserve we should have in the heap to
minimize the probability of promotion failure.
switches.name: G1ReservePercent

switches.description:
Before enqueueing them, each mutator thread tries to do some filtering
on the SATB buffers it generates. If post-filtering the percentage of
retained entries is over this threshold the buffer will be enqueued for
processing. A value of 0 specifies that mutator threads should not do
such filtering.
switches.name: G1SATBBufferEnqueueingThresholdPercent

switches.description: Number of entries in an SATB log buffer.
switches.name: G1SATBBufferSize

switches.description: Size of an update buffer.
switches.name: G1UpdateBufferSize

switches.description:
Select green, yellow and red zones adaptively to meet the the pause
requirements.
switches.name: G1UseAdaptiveConcRefinement

switches.description:
Adaptively adjust the initiating heap occupancy from the initial value
of InitiatingHeapOccupancyPercent. The policy attempts to start marking
in time based on application behavior.
switches.name: G1UseAdaptiveIHOP

switches.description: Verifies the consistency of the marking bitmaps
switches.name: G1VerifyBitmaps

switches.description: Verify the code root lists attached to each heap region.
switches.name: G1VerifyHeapRegionCodeRoots

switches.description:
If true, perform verification of each heap region's remembered set when
verifying the heap during a full GC.
switches.name: G1VerifyRSetsDuringFullGC

switches.description:
Start tracing compiled GC barriers after N garbage collections
(disabled if N <= 0).
switches.name: GCDebugStartCycle

switches.description: Number of entries we will try to leave on the stack during parallel gc
switches.name: GCDrainStackTargetSize

switches.description: Time slice for MMU specification
switches.name: GCPauseIntervalMillis

switches.description: Adaptive size policy application time to GC time ratio
switches.name: GCTimeRatio

switches.description: Generate position independent code
switches.name: GeneratePIC

switches.description: Generate debuginfo for runtime-compiled code.
switches.name: GenerateRuntimeDebugInfo

switches.description: Turn on the benchmark counters, and displays the results on VM shutdown
switches.name: GenericDynamicCounters

switches.description: Use Graal arithmetic stubs instead of HotSpot stubs where possible
switches.name: GraalArithmeticStubs

switches.description:
A filter applied to a method the VM has selected for compilation by
Graal. A method not matching the filter is redirected to a lower tier
compiler. The filter format is the same as for the MethodFilter option.
switches.name: GraalCompileOnly

switches.description:
Graal graph compression is performed when percent of live nodes falls
below this value
switches.name: GraphCompressionThreshold

switches.description:
Size of heap (bytes) per GC thread used in calculating the number of GC
threads
switches.name: HeapSizePerGCThread

switches.description: Failed verification of the heap (if enabled) causes termination.
switches.name: HeapVerificationFailureIsFatal

switches.description: Enable EE partial unrolling in high tier.
switches.name: HighTierPartialUnrolling

switches.description: Testing only option that forces deopts for exception throws
switches.name: HotSpotDeoptExplicitExceptions

switches.description: Testing only option that forces deopts for exception throws
switches.name: HotSpotPostOnExceptions

switches.description: Print inlining optimizations
switches.name: HotSpotPrintInlining

switches.description:
Enable hybrid context for static methods, i.e. uses invocation site as
context for static methods.
switches.name: HybridStaticContext

switches.description: Ignore duplications with a bad benefit cost relation.
switches.name: IgnoreBadDuplications

switches.description: Override the default suppression of specified roots. See: Reports.md.
switches.name: ImageObjectTreeExpandRoots

switches.description: Override the default suppression of specified types. See: Reports.md.
switches.name: ImageObjectTreeExpandTypes

switches.description: Suppress the expansion of specified roots. See: Reports.md.
switches.name: ImageObjectTreeSuppressRoots

switches.description: Suppress the expansion of specified types. See: Reports.md.
switches.name: ImageObjectTreeSuppressTypes

switches.description: Try to avoid emitting code where patching is required
switches.name: ImmutableCode

switches.description: Specifies if initialization timing is enabled.
switches.name: InitTimer

switches.description: Initial heap size (in bytes); zero means use ergonomics
switches.name: InitialHeapSize

switches.description: Percentage of real memory used for initial heap size
switches.name: InitialRAMPercentage

switches.description:
The percent occupancy (IHOP) of the current old generation capacity
above which a concurrent mark cycle will be initiated. Its value may
change over time if adaptive IHOP is enabled, otherwise the value
remains constant. In the latter case a value of 0 will result as
frequent as possible concurrent marking cycles. A value of 100 disables
concurrent marking. Fragmentation waste in the old generation is not
considered free space in this calculation.
switches.name: InitiatingHeapOccupancyPercent

switches.description: The bonus applied to call nodes that can be fully inlined.
switches.name: InlineAllBonus

switches.description: Maximum depth when inlining during bytecode parsing.
switches.name: InlineDuringParsingMaxDepth

switches.description: Inlines trivial methods during bytecode parsing.
switches.name: InlineDuringParsing

switches.description: Inlines intrinsic methods during bytecode parsing.
switches.name: InlineIntrinsicsDuringParsing

switches.description:
Inline calls with megamorphic type profile (i.e., not all types could
be recorded).
switches.name: InlineMegamorphicCalls

switches.description: Inline calls with monomorphic type profile.
switches.name: InlineMonomorphicCalls

switches.description:
Inlines partial intrinsic exits during bytecode parsing when possible.
A partial intrinsic exit is a call within an intrinsic to the method
being intrinsified and denotes semantics of the original method that
the intrinsic does not support.
switches.name: InlinePartialIntrinsicExitDuringParsing

switches.description: Inline calls with polymorphic type profile.
switches.name: InlinePolymorphicCalls

switches.description: Enable inlining
switches.name: Inline

switches.description:
Controls the maximum number of compiler nodes that can be inlined into
the compiled method.
switches.name: InlinedCompilerNodeLimit

switches.description:
The coefficient used to compute the inlining threshold; the higher, the
more to inline.
switches.name: InliningCoefficient

switches.description:
Maximum inlining depth during partial evaluation before reporting an
infinite recursion
switches.name: InliningDepthError

switches.description: Do not unroll the main loop, only create pre-main-post.
switches.name: InsertPreMainPostOnly

switches.description: Inspect analysis graphs.
switches.name: InspectGraphs

switches.description: Path to the contents of the Inspect web server.
switches.name: InspectServerContentPath

switches.description:
Install segfault handler that prints register contents and full Java
stacktrace. Default: enabled for an executable, disabled for a shared
library.
switches.name: InstallSegfaultHandler

switches.description: Intercept also bailout exceptions
switches.name: InterceptBailout

switches.description: Use compiler intrinsifications.
switches.name: Intrinsify

switches.description: Enable dynamic move profiling per method.
switches.name: LIRDynMoveProfileMethod

switches.description: Enable constant load optimization.
switches.name: LIROptConstantLoadOptimization

switches.description: Enable spill move elimination.
switches.name: LIROptLSRAEliminateSpillMoves

switches.description: Enable spill position optimization
switches.name: LIROptLSRAOptimizeSpillPosition

switches.description: Use linear scan stack slot allocation.
switches.name: LIROptLSStackSlotAllocator

switches.description: Enable LIR level optimiztations.
switches.name: LIROptimization

switches.description: Enables profiling of methods.
switches.name: LIRProfileMethods

switches.description:
Enables profiling of move types on LIR level. Move types are for
example stores (register to stack), constant loads (constant to
register) or copies (register to register).
switches.name: LIRProfileMoves

switches.description: LSRA optimization: Only split but do not reassign
switches.name: LSRAOptSplitOnly

switches.description: Enable LSRA optimization
switches.name: LSRAOptimization

switches.description:
Reduces the likelihood of exploring call graphs that have a lot of
children below the root.
switches.name: LargeChildrenCountPenaltyCoefficient

switches.description:
Milliseconds to delay initialization of the libgraal JMX interface.
Specify a negative value to disable the interface altogether.
switches.name: LibGraalManagementDelay

switches.description:
Enable a limit for the number of objects recorded for each type of a
type state before disabling heap sensitivity for that type. The
analysis must be heap sensitive.
switches.name: LimitObjectArrayLength

switches.description:
Lists on the console at VM shutdown the metric names available to the
Timers, Counters and MemUseTrackers options. Note that this only lists
the metrics that were initialized during the VM execution and so will
not include metrics for compiler code that is not executed.
switches.name: ListMetrics

switches.description:
Use a VM runtime call to load and clear the exception object from the
thread at the start of a compiled exception handler.
switches.name: LoadExceptionObjectInVM

switches.description:
File to which logging is sent. A %p in the name will be replaced with a
string identifying the process, usually the process id and %t will be
replaced by System.currentTimeMillis(). If the current runtime is in an
isolate, then %i will be replaced by '<isolate id>' otherwise %i is
removed. An %I is the same as %i except that the replacement is
'<isolate id>@<isolate address>'. Using %o as filename sends logging to
System.out whereas %e sends logging to System.err.
switches.name: LogFile

switches.description: Enable more verbose log output when available
switches.name: LogVerbose

switches.description:
Pattern for specifying scopes in which logging is enabled. See the Dump
option for the pattern syntax.
switches.name: Log

switches.description: Alignment in bytes for loop header blocks.
switches.name: LoopHeaderAlignment

switches.description: Maximum size of marking stack
switches.name: MarkStackSizeMax

switches.description: Size of marking stack
switches.name: MarkStackSize

switches.description: Allow backend to match complex expressions.
switches.name: MatchExpressions

switches.description: The maximum length of the methods context chains.
switches.name: MaxCallingContextDepth

switches.description:
The maximum number of contexts to record for a method. It only affects
the analysis when the max and min calling context depth are different.
switches.name: MaxCallingContextWidth

switches.description:
The maximum number of compilation failures to handle with the action
specified by CompilationFailureAction before changing to a less verbose
action. This does not apply to the ExitVM action.
switches.name: MaxCompilationProblemsPerAction

switches.description:
The maximum number of constant objects recorded for each type before
merging the constants into one unique constant object per type. The
analysis must be heap sensitive. It has a minimum value of 1.
switches.name: MaxConstantObjectsPerType

switches.description:
Upper bound on the number of cpu locals per counter. It has to be a
power of 2.
switches.name: MaxCpuLocalsPerCounter

switches.description: Maximum total size of NIO direct-buffer allocations
switches.name: MaxDirectMemorySize

switches.description:
How much duplication can happen because of irreducible loops before
bailing out.
switches.name: MaxDuplicationFactor

switches.description:
Adaptive size policy maximum GC pause time goal in millisecond, or the
maximum GC time per MMU time slice
switches.name: MaxGCPauseMillis

switches.description:
Maximum node cost graph size for duplication. If a graph is bigger
duplication will stop.
switches.name: MaxGraphSizeNodeCost

switches.description:
The maximum length of the context used to model a heap object in
addition to the allocation site; used only when ContextSensitiveHeap is
enabled.
switches.name: MaxHeapContextDepth

switches.description:
The maximum number of contexts to record for a heap object. It only
affects the analysis when the max and min calling context depth are
different.
switches.name: MaxHeapContextWidth

switches.description: The maximum heap size at run-time, in bytes.
switches.name: MaxHeapSize

switches.description:
The maximum number of lines in the stack trace for Java exceptions (0
means all)
switches.name: MaxJavaStackTraceDepth

switches.description:
Abstract measure of the cost of branch misprediction. Higher values
make generation of conditional moves more likely.
switches.name: MaxMispredictionCostIncreaseFactor

switches.description: The maximum size of the young generation at run-time, in bytes
switches.name: MaxNewSize

switches.description:
The maximum number of objects recorded for each type of a type state
before disabling heap sensitivity for that type. The analysis must be
heap sensitive. It has a minimum value of 1.
switches.name: MaxObjectSetSize

switches.description: The maximum number of dispatches in guarded polymorphic inlining.
switches.name: MaxPolymorphicDispatches

switches.description: Max number of precise inlining peeling iterations.
switches.name: MaxPriorityInliningPeelingIterations

switches.description: Maximum percentage of real memory used for maximum heap size
switches.name: MaxRAMPercentage

switches.description: Real memory size (in bytes) used to set maximum heap size
switches.name: MaxRAM

switches.description:
Maximum simulation-duplication iterations of the duplication
optimization per invocation.
switches.name: MaxSimulationIterations

switches.description: Maximum value for tenuring threshold
switches.name: MaxTenuringThreshold

switches.description: Maximum number of unrolled alignment instructions
switches.name: MaxVectorAlignmentUnroll

switches.description: Maximum length of linear-code vector operations
switches.name: MaxVectorUnroll

switches.description: Maximum desired size of the compiler graph in nodes.
switches.name: MaximumDesiredSize

switches.description: The maximum length of an array that will be escape analyzed.
switches.name: MaximumEscapeAnalysisArrayLength

switches.description: The maximum heap size as percent of physical memory
switches.name: MaximumHeapSizePercent

switches.description:
Inlining is explored up to this number of nodes in the graph for each
call site.
switches.name: MaximumInliningSize

switches.description: Max number of loop explosions per method.
switches.name: MaximumLoopExplosionCount

switches.description: Maximum level of recursive inlining.
switches.name: MaximumRecursiveInlining

switches.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Maximum number of algorithm iterations per
optimization invocation.
switches.name: MaximumTransitiveEnabledPullFactor

switches.description:
The maximum size of the young generation as a percentage of the maximum
heap size
switches.name: MaximumYoungGenerationSizePercent

switches.description:
Minimum probability for methods to be inlined for megamorphic type
profiles.
switches.name: MegamorphicInliningMinMethodProbability

switches.description:
Comma separated names of memory usage trackers that are enabled
irrespective of the value for TrackMemUse option. An empty value
enables all memory usage trackers unconditionally.
switches.name: MemUseTrackers

switches.description:
Only check MethodFilter against the root method in the context if true,
otherwise check all methods
switches.name: MethodFilterRootOnly

switches.description:
Pattern for matching methods. The syntax for a pattern is:
          
  SourcePatterns = SourcePattern ["," SourcePatterns] .
  SourcePattern = [ "~" ] [ Class "." ] method [ "(" [ Parameter { ";" Parameter } ] ")" ] .
  Parameter = Class | "int" | "long" | "float" | "double" | "short" | "char" | "boolean" .
  Class = { package "." } class .
          
Glob pattern matching (*, ?) is allowed in all parts of the source pattern.
The "~" prefix negates the pattern.
          
Positive patterns are joined by an "or" operator: "A,B" matches anything
matched by "A" or "B". Negative patterns are joined by "and not": "~A,~B"
matches anything not matched by "A" and not matched by "B". "A,~B,~C,D"
matches anything matched by "A" or "D" and not matched by "B" and not
matched by "C".
          
A set of patterns containing negative patterns but no positive ones contains
an implicit positive "*" pattern: "~A,~B" is equivalent to "*,~A,~B".
          
Examples of method filters:
---------
  *
          
  Matches all methods in all classes.
---------
  canonical(CanonicalizerTool;LogicNode;LogicNode)
          
  Matches all methods named "canonical", with the first parameter of type
  "CanonicalizerTool", and the second and third parameters of type
  "LogicNode".
  The packages of the parameter types are irrelevant.
---------
  arraycopy(Object;;;;)
          
  Matches all methods named "arraycopy", with the first parameter
  of type "Object", and four more parameters of any type. The
  packages of the parameter types are irrelevant.
---------
  org.graalvm.compiler.nodes.PhiNode.*
          
  Matches all methods in the class "org.graalvm.compiler.nodes.PhiNode".
---------
  org.graalvm.compiler.nodes.*.canonical
          
  Matches all methods named "canonical" in classes in the package
  "org.graalvm.compiler.nodes".
---------
  arraycopy,toString
          
  Matches all methods named "arraycopy" or "toString", meaning that ',' acts
  as an "or" operator.
---------
  java.util.*.*.,~java.util.*Array*.*
  java.util.*.*.,~*Array*.*
          
  These patterns are equivalent and match all methods in the package
  "java.util" except for classes that have "Array" in their name.
---------
  ~java.util.*.*
          
  Matches all methods in all classes in all packages except for anything in
  the "java.util" package.
switches.name: MethodFilter

switches.description:
Per-compilation method inlining exploration limit before giving up (use
0 to disable)
switches.name: MethodInlineBailoutLimit

switches.description:
File to which metrics are dumped per compilation.
A CSV format is used if the file ends with .csv otherwise a more
human readable format is used. The fields in the CSV format are:
           compilable - method being compiled
  compilable_identity - identity hash code of compilable
       compilation_nr - where this compilation lies in the ordered
                        sequence of all compilations identified by
                        compilable_identity
       compilation_id - runtime issued identifier for the compilation
          metric_name - name of metric
         metric_value - value of metric
switches.name: MetricsFile

switches.description: Enable EE partial unrolling in mid tier.
switches.name: MidTierPartialUnrolling

switches.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Ignore low frequency branches during
duplication.
switches.name: MinBlockFrequencyPull

switches.description: The minimum length of the methods context chains.
switches.name: MinCallingContextDepth

switches.description:
The minimum length of the context used to model a heap object in
addition to the allocation site; used only when ContextSensitiveHeap is
enabled.
switches.name: MinHeapContextDepth

switches.description: The minimum change in heap space due to GC (in bytes).
switches.name: MinHeapDeltaBytes

switches.description: The minimum percentage of heap free after GC to avoid expansion.
switches.name: MinHeapFreeRatio

switches.description: The minimum heap size at run-time, in bytes.
switches.name: MinHeapSize

switches.description:
The minimum probability for using a dispatch in guarded polymorphic
inlining.
switches.name: MinPolymorphicDispatchProbability

switches.description:
Minimum percentage of real memory used for maximum heap size on systems
with small physical memory size
switches.name: MinRAMPercentage

switches.description: Minimum allowed TLAB size (in bytes)
switches.name: MinTLABSize

switches.description: Break chained phis
switches.name: MinifyInvertedPhis

switches.description:
If applicable, use bulk zeroing instructions when the zeroing size in
bytes exceeds this threshold.
switches.name: MinimalBulkZeroingSize

switches.description: Try to reduce duplication code size to the minimal amount of code.
switches.name: MinimalRegions

switches.description:
Move guard nodes to earlier places in the dominator tree if all
successors of basic block share a common guard condition.
switches.name: MoveGuardsUpwards

switches.description:
Cost/Benefit heuristic for EE unrolling: If a loop has multiple exits,
cost is increased by this value for every sinking loop exit.
switches.name: MultiExitCostFactorSink

switches.description:
Cost/Benefit heuristic for EE unrolling: If a loop has multiple exits,
cost is increased by this value for every none-sinking loop exit.
switches.name: MultiExitCostFactor

switches.description:
Run level for NoDeadCodeVerifyHandler (0 = off, 1 = info, 2 = verbose,
3 = fatal)
switches.name: NDCV

switches.description: Ratio of old/new generation sizes
switches.name: NewRatio

switches.description: Initial new generation size (in bytes)
switches.name: NewSize

switches.description: Counts the number of instances of each node class.
switches.name: NodeCounters

switches.description:
Number of contiguous identical compiler thread stack traces allowed
before the VM exits on the basis of a stuck compilation.
switches.name: NonFatalIdenticalCompilationSnapshots

switches.description:
Comma separated list of candidate GNU objdump executables. If not
specified, disassembling via GNU objdump is disabled. Otherwise, the
first existing executable in the list is used.
switches.name: ObjdumpExecutables

switches.description: Size of old gen promotion LAB's (in HeapWords)
switches.name: OldPLABSize

switches.description: Initial tenured generation size (in bytes)
switches.name: OldSize

switches.description: Optimize simple if branches with conditional moves
switches.name: OptConditionalMoves

switches.description: Inject stamps on induction variables.
switches.name: OptLoopPhiStamps

switches.description: Propagate equality into dominated nodes.
switches.name: OptPropagateEquality

switches.description: Dump graphs to help debug operation
switches.name: OptStringConcatDump

switches.description: Optimize StringBuilder construction
switches.name: OptStringConcat

switches.description: Eliminate redundant write barriers.
switches.name: OptWriteBarrierElimination

switches.description: Enable access node optimizations for loops
switches.name: OptimizeLoopAccesses

switches.description: Dump information for Profile Guided Optimizations (true or file name)
switches.name: PGOInstrument

switches.description:
Percentage (0-100) used to weight the current sample when computing
exponentially decaying average for ResizePLAB
switches.name: PLABWeight

switches.description:
Scan a subset of object array and push remainder, if array is bigger
than this
switches.name: ParGCArrayScanChunk

switches.description: Wasted fraction of parallel allocation buffer
switches.name: ParallelGCBufferWastePct

switches.description: Number of parallel threads parallel gc will use
switches.name: ParallelGCThreads

switches.description: Enable balancing of reference processing queues
switches.name: ParallelRefProcBalancingEnabled

switches.description: Enable parallel reference processing whenever possible
switches.name: ParallelRefProcEnabled

switches.description: Enable partial redundancy elimination
switches.name: PartialRedundancyElimination

switches.description:
Cost/Benefit heuristic for EE unrolling in high tier: reduce cost by a
constant factor when comparing with relative benefit.
switches.name: PartialUnrollCostReductionFactorHighTier

switches.description:
Cost/Benefit heuristic for EE unrolling in mid tier: reduce cost by a
constant factor when comparing with relative benefit.
switches.name: PartialUnrollCostReductionFactorMidTier

switches.description: Maximum number of iterations to unroll for a high tier main loop.
switches.name: PartialUnrollMaxIterationsHighTier

switches.description: Maximum number of iterations to unroll for a mid tier main loop.
switches.name: PartialUnrollMaxIterationsMidTier

switches.description:
Maximum node cost size of a loop to be considered for high tier
unrolling.
switches.name: PartialUnrollMaxSizeHighTier

switches.description:
Maximum node cost size of a loop to be considered for mid tier tier
unrolling.
switches.name: PartialUnrollMaxSizeMidTier

switches.description: Minimal loop frequency to consider a loop for partial unrolling
switches.name: PartialUnrollMinFrequency

switches.description:
The limit on the number of paths at control-flow merges. Decreasing
this value reduces the number of paths, but also shortens them.
switches.name: PathProfileCutThreshold

switches.description:
Dump information for path profile (null or file name). If set to null,
then dumping is disabled.
switches.name: PathProfileDumpFile

switches.description:
Maximum acceptable number of paths coming from the inbound of a merge
if both of them are frequent.
switches.name: PathProfileFrequentThreshold

switches.description:
If some block's relative frequency drops below this number times the
maximum relative frequency in the graph, then the block is considered
infrequent.
switches.name: PathProfileGlobalLowFrequencyRatio

switches.description:
If the ratio of the merge's frequency with its inbound's frequency is
greater than this threshold, then the inbound is considered infrequent.
switches.name: PathProfileLocalLowFrequencyRatio

switches.description:
Maximum number of counters to use in path profiling for all
instrumented methods.
switches.name: PathProfileMaxTotalCounters

switches.description:
Enable or disable the path-profiling algorithm. If it enables it, it
also allows to select which mode to execute.
switches.name: PathProfilePolicy

switches.description: Controls whether the path-regeneration algorithm is executed.
switches.name: PathProfileRegenerate

switches.description: Minimal loop frequency necessary to consider peeling.
switches.name: PeelingConsideredMinFrequency

switches.description:
Increase the cost of duplicating control flow splits inside loops if
they are not foldable.The generally tend to complicate control flow and
generate worse code in the backend.
switches.name: PenalizeComplexLoopControlFlow

switches.description:
Percentage of total collection time that should be spent on young
generation collections.
switches.name: PercentTimeInIncrementalCollection

switches.description:
Size of performance data memory region. Will be rounded up to a
multiple of the native os page size.
switches.name: PerfDataMemorySize

switches.description: Jvmstat instrumentation sampling interval (in milliseconds)
switches.name: PerfDataSamplingInterval

switches.description: Maximum PerfStringConstant string length before truncation
switches.name: PerfMaxStringConstLength

switches.description: Minimal loop frequency to consider a loop for inverted phi minifaction.
switches.name: PhiMinificationMinimalLoopFrequency

switches.description: Per-thread chunk size for parallel memory pre-touch.
switches.name: PreTouchParallelChunkSize

switches.description:
Calculate the container CPU availability based on the value of quotas
(if set), when true. Otherwise, use the CPU shares value, provided it
is less than quota.
switches.name: PreferContainerQuotaForCPUCount

switches.description: How far ahead to prefetch destination area (<= 0 means off)
switches.name: PrefetchCopyIntervalInBytes

switches.description: How far ahead to prefetch scan area (<= 0 means off)
switches.name: PrefetchScanIntervalInBytes

switches.description:
Print analysis call tree, a breadth-first tree reduction of the call
graph.
switches.name: PrintAnalysisCallTree

switches.description: Print analysis results statistics.
switches.name: PrintAnalysisStatistics

switches.description:
Enable dumping LIR, register allocation and code generation info to the
C1Visualizer.
switches.name: PrintBackendCFG

switches.description: Enable dumping CFG built during initial BciBlockMapping
switches.name: PrintBlockMapping

switches.description:
Enable dumping to the C1Visualizer. Enabling this option implies
PrintBackendCFG.
switches.name: PrintCFG

switches.description:
Choose format used when dumping canonical text for graphs: 0 gives a
scheduled graph (better for spotting changes involving the schedule)
while 1 gives a CFG containing expressions rooted at fixed nodes
(better for spotting small structure differences)
switches.name: PrintCanonicalGraphStringFlavor

switches.description: Enable dumping canonical text from for graphs.
switches.name: PrintCanonicalGraphStrings

switches.description:
Print an informational line to the console for each completed
compilation.
switches.name: PrintCompilation

switches.description: Prints VM configuration available via JVMCI.
switches.name: PrintConfig

switches.description: Print detailed information for each allocation site
switches.name: PrintDetailedAllocationProfiling

switches.description:
Print extra help, if available, based on comma-separated option names.
Pass * to show all options that contain extra help.
switches.name: PrintFlagsWithExtraHelp

switches.description:
Show available options based on comma-separated option-types (allowed
categories: User, Expert, Debug).
switches.name: PrintFlags

switches.description: Print summary GC information after application main method returns.
switches.name: PrintGCSummary

switches.description: Print a time stamp at each collection, if +PrintGC or +VerboseGC.
switches.name: PrintGCTimeStamps

switches.description:
Print the time for each of the phases of each collection, if
+VerboseGC.
switches.name: PrintGCTimes

switches.description: Print summary GC information after each collection
switches.name: PrintGC

switches.description:
Setting to true sets PrintGraph=file, setting to false sets
PrintGraph=network
switches.name: PrintGraphFile

switches.description: Host part of the address to which graphs are dumped.
switches.name: PrintGraphHost

switches.description: Port part of the address to which graphs are dumped in binary format.
switches.name: PrintGraphPort

switches.description: Schedule graphs as they are dumped.
switches.name: PrintGraphWithSchedule

switches.description:
Where IdealGraphVisualizer graph dumps triggered by Dump or DumpOnError
should be written.
The accepted values are:
      File - Dump IGV graphs to the local file system (see DumpPath).
   Network - Dump IGV graphs to the network destination specified by PrintGraphHost and PrintGraphPort.
             If a network connection cannot be opened, dumping falls back to file dumping. 
   Disable - Do not dump IGV graphs.
switches.name: PrintGraph

switches.description:
Print the shape of the heap before and after each collection, if
+VerboseGC.
switches.name: PrintHeapShape

switches.description: Print HIR along side LIR as the latter is generated
switches.name: PrintIRWithLIR

switches.description: Print image object hierarchy.
switches.name: PrintImageObjectTree

switches.description: Include the LIR as comments with the final assembly.
switches.name: PrintLIRWithAssembly

switches.description: Report analysis statistics.
switches.name: PrintPointsToStatistics

switches.description: Print profiling information when parsing a method's bytecode
switches.name: PrintProfilingInformation

switches.description: Print types used for Java synchronization.
switches.name: PrintSynchronizedAnalysis

switches.description: The policy to use, must be empty for automatic resolution.
switches.name: PriorityInliningPolicy

switches.description:
Comma-separated list of analysis policies for exploring the methods in
the call graph and for inlining, empty for no policy.
switches.name: PriorityInliningTuningPolicy

switches.description: Control probabilistic profiling on AMD64
switches.name: ProbabilisticProfiling

switches.description:
Control the naming and granularity of the counters when using
ProfileAllocations.
The accepted values are:
        AllocatingMethod - a counter per method
         InstanceOrArray - one counter for all instance allocations and
                           one counter for all array allocations 
           AllocatedType - one counter per allocated type
  AllocatedTypesInMethod - one counter per allocated type, per method
switches.name: ProfileAllocationsContext

switches.description: Enable profiling of allocation sites.
switches.name: ProfileAllocations

switches.description: Track the progress of the static analysis.
switches.name: ProfileAnalysisOperations

switches.description: Emit profiling of backedges
switches.name: ProfileBackedges

switches.description: Track the creation of constant objects.
switches.name: ProfileConstantObjects

switches.description:
Integer greater than zero representing the duration in seconds that
will be used to trigger a profile capture. Any integer less than one
disables periodic dumps
switches.name: ProfileDumpPeriod

switches.description: Emit profiling of invokes
switches.name: ProfileInvokes

switches.description: Enable profiling of monitor operations.
switches.name: ProfileMonitors

switches.description:
Excludes time spent in invoked methods; measures total time including
subcalls when turned off.
switches.name: ProfileSelfTime

switches.description: Profile simple methods
switches.name: ProfileSimpleMethods

switches.description: Value should point to a profile dump file.
switches.name: ProfilesDumpFile

switches.description: Maximum depth of dependency when propagating equals property.
switches.name: PropagateEqualityDepth

switches.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Percentage in node cost graph size for the
floating node duplication budget. Computed relative to the method's
graph size.
switches.name: PullThroughPhiCodeSizeIncrease

switches.description:
Number of times an allocation that queues behind a GC will retry before
printing a warning
switches.name: QueuedAllocationWarningCount

switches.description: Re-associate loop invariants and constants.
switches.name: ReassociateExpressions

switches.description: Disable optional dead code eliminations
switches.name: ReduceDCE

switches.description:
Select type of reference discovery policy: reference-based(0) or
referent-based(1)
switches.name: RefDiscoveryPolicy

switches.description:
Comma separated list of registers that register allocation is limited
to.
switches.name: RegisterPressure

switches.description:
The coefficient used to compute the inlining threshold; the higher, the
hard to inline.
switches.name: RelativeBenefitInliningCoefficient

switches.description:
Allow a type flow state to contain types not compatible with its
declared type.
switches.name: RelaxTypeFlowStateConstraints

switches.description: Enable the type flow saturation analysis performance optimization.
switches.name: RemoveSaturatedTypeFlows

switches.description: Dynamically resize (survivor space) promotion LAB's
switches.name: ResizePLAB

switches.description: Dynamically resize TLAB size for threads
switches.name: ResizeTLAB

switches.description: Try avoid unrolling vectorizable loops.
switches.name: RespectVectorization

switches.description: Directory where Java source-files will be placed for the debugger
switches.name: RuntimeSourceDestDir

switches.description: Set the number of dominating and dominated blocks scanned per block
switches.name: SIMDVectorizationWindowSize

switches.description:
Exit the VM if I can not come to a safepoint in this many nanoseconds.
0 implies forever.
switches.name: SafepointPromptnessFailureNanos

switches.description:
Print a warning if I can not come to a safepoint in this many
nanoseconds. 0 implies forever.
switches.name: SafepointPromptnessWarningNanos

switches.description: Object scanning in parallel
switches.name: ScanObjectsParallel

switches.description:
Simulation can either only process fixed nodes or schedule the graph
and also process floating nodes.
switches.name: ScheduledDuplicationSimulation

switches.description:
Writes to the VM log information about the compiler configuration
selected.
switches.name: ShowConfiguration

switches.description: Print the name of each dump file path as it's created.
switches.name: ShowDumpFiles

switches.description:
Controls whether the source position information of snippets and method
substitutions are exposed to HotSpot. Can be useful when profiling to
get more precise position information.
switches.name: ShowSubstitutionSourceInfo

switches.description: Handle simple cases for inflated monitors in the fast-path.
switches.name: SimpleFastInflatedLocking

switches.description: Maximum number of calls in a simple method
switches.name: SimpleMethodCalls

switches.description: Maximum number of nodes in a graph for a simple method
switches.name: SimpleMethodGraphSize

switches.description: Maximum number of indirect calls in a simple moethod
switches.name: SimpleMethodIndirectCalls

switches.description: Use DBDS algorithm to simulate the impact of peeling on a loop.
switches.name: SimulationBasedLoopPeeling

switches.description: Ignore low frequency branches during simulation.
switches.name: SimulationPruneUnlikelyBranches

switches.description:
If the previous low-level graph size of the method exceeds the
threshold, it is not inlined.
switches.name: SmallCompiledLowLevelGraphSize

switches.description:
Reduces the likelihood of exploring call graphs with IR size much
larger than the root.
switches.name: SmallRootIrPenaltyCoefficient

switches.description: Enable counters for various paths in snippets.
switches.name: SnippetCounters

switches.description: Number of milliseconds per MB of free space in the heap.
switches.name: SoftRefLRUPolicyMSPerMB

switches.description:
Select a strategy to mitigate speculative bounds check bypass (aka
Spectre-PHT or Spectre V1).
This is an experimental option - execution of untrusted code is not supported by GraalVM CE.
The accepted values are:
                  None - No mitigations are used in JIT compiled code.
            AllTargets - Speculative execution on all conditional branch targets is
                         stopped using speculative execution barrier instructions.
          GuardTargets - Branch targets relevant to Java memory safety are instrumented
                         with barrier instructions. This option has less performance impact
                         than AllTargets. 
  NonDeoptGuardTargets - Same as GuardTargets, except that branches which deoptimize are not
                         protected since they can not be executed repeatedly and are thus less
                         likely to be successfully exploited in an attack.
          
                         
Note that all modes except "None" will also instrument branch target blocks containing UNSAFE memory accesses
with barrier instructions.
switches.name: SpectrePHTBarriers

switches.description: Mask indices to scope access to allocation size after bounds check.
switches.name: SpectrePHTIndexMasking

switches.description: Speculates that arrays have exact type to optimize store checks
switches.name: SpeculativeStoreCheck

switches.description: The size of each thread stack at run-time, in bytes.
switches.name: StackSize

switches.description: Start flight recording with options.
switches.name: StartFlightRecording

switches.description: Stress the code emitting explicit exception throwing code.
switches.name: StressExplicitExceptionCode

switches.description: Stress the code emitting invokes with explicit exception edges.
switches.name: StressInvokeWithExceptionNode

switches.description: Stress the code by emitting reads at earliest instead of latest point.
switches.name: StressTestEarlyReads

switches.description:
String.indexOf invocations will be evaluated at compile time if the
receiver is a constant and its length is lower than this value.
switches.name: StringIndexOfLimit

switches.description:
Support OSR compilations with locks. If DeoptAfterOSR is true we can
per definition not have unbalanced enter/exits mappings. If
DeoptAfterOSR is false insert artificial monitor enters after the
OSRStart to have balanced enter/exits in the graph.
switches.name: SupportOSRWithLocks

switches.description: Ratio of eden/survivor space size
switches.name: SurvivorRatio

switches.description: Allocation averaging weight
switches.name: TLABAllocationWeight

switches.description: Maximum TLAB waste at a refill (internal fragmentation)
switches.name: TLABRefillWasteFraction

switches.description: Starting TLAB size (in bytes); zero means set ergonomically
switches.name: TLABSize

switches.description: Increment allowed waste at slow allocation
switches.name: TLABWasteIncrement

switches.description: Percentage of Eden that can be wasted
switches.name: TLABWasteTargetPercent

switches.description: Target wasted space in last buffer as percent of overall allocation
switches.name: TargetPLABWastePct

switches.description: Desired percentage of survivor space used after scavenge
switches.name: TargetSurvivorRatio

switches.description:
The number of nanoseconds before tearing down an isolate gives a
failure message. 0 implies no message.
switches.name: TearDownFailureNanos

switches.description:
The number of nanoseconds before and between which tearing down an
isolate gives a warning message. 0 implies no warning.
switches.name: TearDownWarningNanos

switches.description: Backedge notification frequency
switches.name: TierABackedgeNotifyFreqLog

switches.description: Backedge profile probability
switches.name: TierABackedgeProfileProbabilityLog

switches.description:
Inlinee invocation notification frequency (-1 means count, but do not
notify)
switches.name: TierAInvokeInlineeNotifyFreqLog

switches.description: Invocation notification frequency
switches.name: TierAInvokeNotifyFreqLog

switches.description: Invocation profile probability
switches.name: TierAInvokeProfileProbabilityLog

switches.description: Do profiling and callbacks to tiered runtime
switches.name: TieredAOT

switches.description: Profile method execution time.
switches.name: TimeStampProfiling

switches.description:
Pattern for specifying scopes in which timing is enabled. See the Dump
option for the pattern syntax. An empty value enables all timers
unconditionally.
switches.name: Time

switches.description:
Turn on the benchmark counters, and displays the results every n
milliseconds
switches.name: TimedDynamicCounters

switches.description:
Comma separated names of timers that are enabled irrespective of the
value for Time option. An empty value enables all timers
unconditionally.
switches.name: Timers

switches.description: Enables detailed tracing of auxiliary image events.
switches.name: TraceAuxiliaryImageClassHistogram

switches.description: Enables detailed tracing of auxiliary image events.
switches.name: TraceAuxiliaryImageReferenceTree

switches.description:
The trace level for the bytecode parser. A value of 1 enables
instruction tracing and any greater value emits a frame state trace
just prior to each instruction trace.Instruction tracing output from
multiple compiler threads will be interleaved so use of this option
make most sense for single threaded compilation. The MethodFilter
option can be used to refine tracing to selected methods.
switches.name: TraceBytecodeParserLevel

switches.description: Print logging information for runtime code cache modifications
switches.name: TraceCodeCache

switches.description: Print verbose logging information for every deoptimization
switches.name: TraceDeoptimizationDetails

switches.description: Print logging information for every deoptimization
switches.name: TraceDeoptimization

switches.description: Trace execution of stub used to handle an exception thrown by a callee.
switches.name: TraceExceptionHandlerStub

switches.description:
Trace heap chunks during collections, if +VerboseGC and
+PrintHeapShape.
switches.name: TraceHeapChunks

switches.description: Traces inlining performed during bytecode parsing.
switches.name: TraceInlineDuringParsing

switches.description: Enable inlining decision tracing in stubs and snippets.
switches.name: TraceInliningForStubsAndSnippets

switches.description:
Enable tracing of inlining decisions.
Output format:
  compilation of 'Signature of the compilation root method':
    at 'Signature of the root method' ['Bytecode index']: <'Phase'> 'Child method signature': 'Decision made about this callsite'
      at 'Signature of the child method' ['Bytecode index']: 
         |--<'Phase 1'> 'Grandchild method signature': 'First decision made about this callsite'
         \--<'Phase 2'> 'Grandchild method signature': 'Second decision made about this callsite'
      at 'Signature of the child method' ['Bytecode index']: <'Phase'> 'Another grandchild method signature': 'The only decision made about this callsite.'
switches.name: TraceInlining

switches.description: The trace level for the LIR generator
switches.name: TraceLIRGeneratorLevel

switches.description:
Enables tracing of profiling info when read by JVMCI.
Empty value: trace all methods
Non-empty value: trace methods whose fully qualified name contains the value.
switches.name: TraceMethodDataFilter

switches.description:
Trace monitor operations in methods whose fully qualified name contains
this substring.
switches.name: TraceMonitorsMethodFilter

switches.description: Trace monitor operations on objects whose type contains this substring.
switches.name: TraceMonitorsTypeFilter

switches.description: Traces use of plugins during bytecode parsing.
switches.name: TraceParserPlugins

switches.description:
Trace execution of the stub that routes an exception to a handler in
the calling frame.
switches.name: TraceUnwindStub

switches.description: Track the callers for methods and accessing methods for fields.
switches.name: TrackAccessChain

switches.description:
Enable (if Count is enabled) graph size tracking during every
duplication iteration.
switches.name: TrackGraphSizesInDuplication

switches.description:
Track inlining statistics (inlining duration, call tree size, compiler
node counts, and the number of callsites). One of: none, interactive
switches.name: TrackInliningStatistics

switches.description: Track the input for type flows.
switches.name: TrackInputFlows

switches.description:
Pattern for specifying scopes in which memory use tracking is enabled.
See the Dump option for the pattern syntax. An empty value enables all
memory use trackers unconditionally.
switches.name: TrackMemUse

switches.description: Track source stack trace where a node was inserted into the graph.
switches.name: TrackNodeInsertion

switches.description: Track the NodeSourcePosition.
switches.name: TrackNodeSourcePosition

switches.description:
Graphs with less than this number of nodes are trivial and therefore
always inlined.
switches.name: TrivialInliningSize

switches.description:
Loop peeling will consider any loop with a size (in terms of estimated
machine instructions) below this value to be a prime candidate for
peeling. Larger loops will only be considered for peeling if the
simulated benefit of peeling is relatively high. The larger the loop,
the greater the expected benefit has to be.
switches.name: TrivialLoopSizeLimitForPeeling

switches.description:
Select a compiler configuration for Truffle compilation (default: use
Graal system compiler configuration).
switches.name: TruffleCompilerConfiguration

switches.description:
Determines whether to treat final fields with default values as
constant.
switches.name: TrustFinalDefaultFields

switches.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Enable floating node duplication over
multiple phi nodes at once.
switches.name: TryExplodeOverPhis

switches.description:
PullThroughPhiOptimization: Enable floating node duplication over phis
where the target node has different phis as input.
switches.name: TryPhiPhiPulls

switches.description:
Increases or decreases the time spent exploring inlining opportunities
under the assumption that more time results in better peak performance
and less time reduces time to reach (a lower) peak performance. The
value of the option is clamped between -1 and 1 inclusive. Anything
below 0, reduces the exploration time and anything above 0 increases
exploration time. Note that this option is only a heuristic and should
be tuned for any specific application.
switches.name: TuneInlinerExploration

switches.description:
The maximum number of profiled types that will be used when compiling a
profiled type check. Note that TypeCheckMinProfileHitProbability also
influences whether profiling info is used in compiled type checks.
switches.name: TypeCheckMaxHints

switches.description:
If the probability that a type check will hit one the profiled types
(up to TypeCheckMaxHints) is below this value, the type check will be
compiled without profiling info
switches.name: TypeCheckMinProfileHitProbability

switches.description:
How many levels of inputs to print. A value of 0 prints only the target
flow.
switches.name: TypeFlowPrinterInRadius

switches.description:
How many levels of outputs to print. A value of 0 prints only the
target flow.
switches.name: TypeFlowPrinterOutRadius

switches.description:
The maximum number of types recorded in a type flow. -1 indicates no
limitation.
switches.name: TypeFlowSaturationCutoff

switches.description: Denotes the call graph size that is considered medium size.
switches.name: TypicalCallGraphSize

switches.description:
The increase in estimated typical graph size after inlining, per each
extra invoke.
switches.name: TypicalGraphSizeInvokeBonus

switches.description: The maximum in estimated inlined typical graph size.
switches.name: TypicalGraphSizeMax

switches.description: The typical graph size at which inlining pressure must start growing.
switches.name: TypicalGraphSize

switches.description: Report unresolved elements as errors.
switches.name: UnresolvedIsError

switches.description: Unroll empty loops.
switches.name: UnrollEmptyLoops

switches.description: Unroll inverted (tail counted) loops.
switches.name: UnrollInvertedLoops

switches.description: Unroll loops with multiple loop ends.
switches.name: UnrollMultiEndLoops

switches.description: Unroll loops with multiple loop exits.
switches.name: UnrollMultiExitLoops

switches.description:
Force branch instructions to align with 32-bytes boundary, to mitigate
the jcc erratum. See
https://www.intel.com/content/dam/support/us/en/documents/processors/mitigations-jump-conditional-code-erratum.pdf
for more details. If not set explicitly, the default value will be
determined according to the CPU model.
switches.name: UseBranchesWithin32ByteBoundary

switches.description: Enables CompilationStatistics.
switches.name: UseCompilationStatistics

switches.description:
Dynamically choose the number of threads up to a maximum of
ParallelGCThreads parallel collectors will use for garbage collection
work
switches.name: UseDynamicNumberOfGCThreads

switches.description:
Encode and decode snippets and substitutions before parsing to test
libgraal code path. This option is ignored in the context of libgraal.
switches.name: UseEncodedGraphs

switches.description:
Use Graal-generated stubs for complicated LIR operations instead of
embedding all the emitted code.
switches.name: UseGraalStubs

switches.description: Turn on graph caching.
switches.name: UseGraphCache

switches.description: Flag to disable jvmstat instrumentation for performance testing.
switches.name: UsePerfData

switches.description: Use priority-based inlining.
switches.name: UsePriorityInlining
UseProfilingInformation

switches.description: Use a cache for snippet graphs.
switches.name: UseSnippetGraphCache

switches.description: Use a LRU cache for snippet templates.
switches.name: UseSnippetTemplateCache

switches.description: Use traps for null checks instead of explicit null-checks
switches.name: UseTrappingNullChecks

switches.description: Use absolute path for source-filenames in VTune events.
switches.name: VTuneAbsoluteFilenames

switches.description:
Only generate SIMD loops for vector folds expected to iterate at least
this many times.
switches.name: VectorFoldMinIterations

switches.description: Enable vectorized array copy intrinsics
switches.name: VectorIntrinsics

switches.description: Unroll vectorized loops
switches.name: VectorUnroll

switches.description: Enable vectorization.
switches.name: Vectorization

switches.description: Enable vectorized array initialization
switches.name: VectorizeAllocation

switches.description: Enable vectorization of conditional code.
switches.name: VectorizeConditional

switches.description: Enable vectorization of loops with conditional deopts before writes.
switches.name: VectorizeDeopts

switches.description:
Enable vectorization of loops implementing a higher-order 'fold'
function.
switches.name: VectorizeFoldShaped

switches.description: Enable vectorization of vector gather operations.
switches.name: VectorizeGather

switches.description: Enable vectorization of hashCode patterns.
switches.name: VectorizeHashes

switches.description: Enable vectorization of loops
switches.name: VectorizeLoops

switches.description:
Enable vectorization of loops implementing a higher-order 'map'
function.
switches.name: VectorizeMapShaped

switches.description: Enable vectorization of loops with negative strides.
switches.name: VectorizeNegativeStride

switches.description: Enable detection of SIMD patterns
switches.name: VectorizeSIMD

switches.description: Enable vectorization of loops with safepoints.
switches.name: VectorizeSafepoints

switches.description: Enable vectorization of sequence values.
switches.name: VectorizeSequence

switches.description: Print more information about the heap before and after each collection
switches.name: VerboseGC

switches.description: Verify memory system after GC
switches.name: VerifyAfterGC

switches.description: Emit extra code to dynamically check monitor operations are balanced.
switches.name: VerifyBalancedMonitors

switches.description: Verify memory system before GC
switches.name: VerifyBeforeGC

switches.description: Verify memory system during GC (between phases)
switches.name: VerifyDuringGC

switches.description: GC invoke count where +VerifyHeap kicks in
switches.name: VerifyGCStartAt

switches.description:
Perform expensive verification of graph inputs, usages, successors and
predecessors
switches.name: VerifyGraalGraphEdges

switches.description: Verify graphs often during compilation when assertions are turned on
switches.name: VerifyGraalGraphs

switches.description:
Verify before - after relation of the relative, computed, code size of
a graph
switches.name: VerifyGraalPhasesSize

switches.description: Perform platform dependent validation of the Java heap at returns
switches.name: VerifyHeapAtReturn

switches.description: Verify that there are no new unused nodes when performing killCFG
switches.name: VerifyKillCFGUnusedNodes

switches.description: Run expensive checks to verify the graph after loop vectorization.
switches.name: VerifyLoopVectorization

switches.description: Verify GC remembered sets
switches.name: VerifyRememberedSets

switches.description: Add code to verify that eliminated barriers weren't needed.
switches.name: VerifyWriteBarrierElimination

switches.description:
Pattern for specifying scopes in which logging is enabled. See the Dump
option for the pattern syntax.
switches.name: Verify

switches.description: Allocate code cache with write access, allowing inlining of objects
switches.name: WriteableCodeCache

switches.description: Size of young gen promotion LAB's (in HeapWords)
switches.name: YoungPLABSize

switches.description: Zero out the newly created TLAB
switches.name: ZeroTLAB
